The Yamato is the unique Battleship replacement for Japan which is significantly more powerful. It has increased range, attack, strength, defense against attack and earns Great Admiral Points on kills. Use them to dominate the seas in the end game, giving you the edge for a Domination Victory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Each Yamato gives points towards a Golden Age when constructed, but sinking a Yamato rewards enemies with Golden Age points and Culture, so don't leave your Yamatos without an escort.

The Yamato-class battleships were battleships of the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) constructed and operated during World War II. Displacing 72,000 long tons (73,000 t) at full load, the vessels were the heaviest and most powerfully armed battleships ever constructed. The class carried the largest naval artillery ever fitted to a warship, nine 460-millimetre (18.1 in) naval guns, each capable of firing 1,360 kg (3,000 lb) shells over 42 km (26 mi). Two battleships of the class (Yamato and Musashi) were completed, while a third (Shinano) was converted to an aircraft carrier during construction. All were sunk by American forces during WWII.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
Due to their size, speed, and power, The Yamato-class visibly embodied Japan's determination and readiness to defend its interests against the western powers, especially the United States. One of the reasons that the warship may have such significance in Japanese culture is that the word "Yamato" was often used as a poetic name for Japan itself. Thus, the construction and subsequent destruction of the Yamato battleships could serve as a metaphor for the rise and fall of Japanese imperial aspirations.
